page.title: 08NATURAL HISTORY (ii)
page.content: The heaths of Week Down,Nattadon and Meldon and abundant flora in the lanes provide an ideal habitat for butterflies.Even on a dull day there were seen:Gatekeeper,Common Blue, Peacock,Comma and Small White,and on other days:Red Admiral,Tortoiseshell, Copper,Orange Tip,Meadow Brown, Brimstone,Marbled White and Small Heath.Sika deer may be seen in the wooded valley along Week Brook.Foxes are numerous;rabbits are on the increase but a new outbreak of myxamatosis may reverse this trend.Badgers are everywhere despite Government efforts to eliminate them. Bats live at Horselake and in Torr House and Torr Cottage-a protected species.Moles are plentiful,as are grey squirrels.There are Dartmoor ponies on Meldon and Week Down,but the breed is no longer pure.
